alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 21 at 3:46AM PST until February 23 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 4 to 9 feet with local sets to 11 feet. Dangerous rip currents. peak overnight Tuesday into early Wednesday morning. * WHERE...Southern Santa Barbara County. The largest surf will be on west-facing beaches. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 3 AM PST Thursday, peaking overnight tonight into early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast
